original: Höglund, Nils Otto, överstelöjtnant, Borås-, f. 3/2/81 i Sthlm av grosshandk, fil. dr Otto H. o. Clara Werner. G. 06 m. Elsa Kockum. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 99, off:ex. 01, KHS 06-08. Und :löjtn. v. Västg. reg. 01, löjtn. 03, kapt. 16, major v. Älvsb. reg. 26, öv:-löjtn. i armén 35, avsk. 36. Tjg. v. gen .-.staben 12-16, reg :kvartermäst. 16- 20, tjg. i franska armén 25, befälh. i. Borås fo 41-42, platshefälh.^ i Trollhättan 43-44. Insp. f. Borås komm. flicksk. ’^d. 42, chefinstr. i Älvsb. landst :förb. . 27-36, v. ordf. sed. 36, ordf. i Borås fältrittkl. 26-36, v. ordf. i Västgöta reg. kaniratfören. sed. 28, ordf. i Boråsavd. av fören. Norden sed. 38, suppl. i centr :styr. f. fören. Norden sed. 43, ordf. i Borås lokal-fören. av Riksfören. f. svenskh. bev. i uti. sed 39. Skr.: Geografi över Sv:e o. dess grannländer I-II (19-20), upps. i nord., mil. o. polit. ämnen i tidn. o. tidskr. RSO, Älvsb. landst:förb. GM, LandstrSM.
translated: Höglund, Nils Otto, Lieutenant Colonel, Borås-, born February 3rd, 1881 in Stockholm to the merchant and PhD Otto H. and Clara Werner. Married in 1906 to Elsa Kockum. He passed the Stockholm Studentexamen in 1899, the Officer Exam in 1901, and attended the Royal Military Academy from 1906-1908. He was an Infantry Second Lieutenant in the Västgöta Regiment from 1901-1903, a Lieutenant from 1903-1916, a Captain from 1916-1926, and a Major in the Älvsborg Regiment from 1926-1935. He retired in 1936 as a Lieutenant Colonel. He served in the General Staff from 1912-1916, was a regimental quartermaster from 1916-1920, served in the French army in 1925, was in charge of the Borås district from 1941-1942, and was the local commander in Trollhättan from 1943-1944. He was an inspector for the Borås girls' school in 1942, chief instructor in the Älvsborg county association from 1927-1936, vice chairman of this association in 1936 and chairman of the Borås cavalry riding club from 1926-1936. He was the vice chairman of the Västgöta regiment's artillery association since 1928, chairman of the Borås branch of the Nordens association since 1938, a member of the central board of the Nordens association since 1943, and the chairman of the Borås local branch of the National Association for Swedish Heritage Preservation Abroad since 1939. He wrote: Geography of Sweden and its neighboring countries I-II (1919-1920), articles on Nordic, military, and political topics in newspapers and journals, and was awarded the Order of the Sword, the Älvsborg county association's medal, and the Landstorm's medal.
